alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 7:53PM EDT until July 04 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL BURLINGTON AND NORTHWESTERN CAMDEN COUNTIES... At 753 PM EDT, emergency management reported that Station Avenue remains closed in Haddonfield and Haddon Heights as a result of flooding. Between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. While heavy rainfall has ended, flash flooding remains ongoing. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Gloucester City, Cherry Hill, Evesham, Mount Laurel, Voorhees, Bellmawr, Palmyra, Magnolia, Westville, and Brooklawn. This includes the following highways... New Jersey Turnpike near exit 4. Interstate 76 in New Jersey between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 28 and 41. Interstate 676 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 4. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
